alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford; White Mountains of Graham and Greenlee Counties including Hannagan Meadow (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 4:19PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Graham, northeastern Cochise and southeastern Greenlee Counties through 500 PM MST... At 418 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles southwest of Virden to 16 miles northwest of Thatcher. Movement was southwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Safford, Thatcher, Solomon, Bowie, Roper Lake State Park, Safford Regional Airport, Pima, Duncan, Central, Franklin, Swift Trail Junction, Fort Grant, Mount Graham, Bonita, San Simon and Frye Mesa Dam. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 348 and 385. Route 70 between mile markers 308 and 385. Route 75 between mile markers 379 and 387. Route 191 between mile markers 88 and 147. Route 266 between mile markers 105 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
